meanings.definition: To manufacture (a product) again, typically using recycled or refurbished parts.
meanings.sent1: The company will remanufacture old computers to sell them again.
meanings.sent2: It is common for car manufacturers to remanufacture engines for reuse.
meanings.sent3: The factory decided to remanufacture the broken toys into new ones.
meanings.sent4: She was able to remanufacture her old dress into a trendy skirt.
meanings.sent5: The artist's goal was to remanufacture trash into beautiful sculptures.

meanings.definition: The act of remanufacturing a product.
meanings.sent1: The remanufacture of smartphones is an eco-friendly practice.
meanings.sent2: After the remanufacture, the printer looked and worked like new.
meanings.sent3: The remanufacture of the vintage car was a labor of love for the mechanic.
meanings.sent4: The company's success was due to their efficient remanufacture process.
meanings.sent5: The remanufacture of the furniture gave it a second life in the market.
